_header: Though man for his offence and great demerit
Subjects: Arthur, prince of Wales; Catharine of Aragon; occasional verse; pageant verses
_description: Speech of Prelacy at the pageant celebrating the marriage of Prince Arthur to Princess Catharine — four stanzas rhyme royal

BLCottVitAXVI.First Lines: Though man for his offence & grete dementffel from his honour by Right & Iustice…
BLCottVitAXVI.Last Lines: …Wherfore Madame to honour ye shall procedeBeyng of those vertues the gwerdon & the mede
